configuration.name: preprocessScript
query
configuration.value: SELECT * FROM ${TABLE_NAME} WHERE id > ${OFFSET} ORDER BY id

configuration.name: script
configuration.value:
record = records[0]

# JOHN => John.
record.value['firstName'] = record.value['firstName'].title()

# DOE  => Doe.
record.value['lastName'] = record.value['lastName'].title()

output.write(record)

configDefinitions.label: Start Event
configDefinitions.description: Stage that should handle pipeline start event.
configDefinitions.name: startEventStage

configDefinitions.label: Stop Event
configDefinitions.description: Stage that should handle pipeline stop event.
configDefinitions.name: stopEventStage

configDefinitions.label: Trigger Interval (millis)
configDefinitions.description: Time interval between generation of batches
configDefinitions.name: triggerInterval

configDefinitions.label: Retry Attempts
configDefinitions.description: Max no of retries. To retry indefinitely, use -1. The wait time between retries starts at 15 seconds and doubles until reaching 5 minutes.
configDefinitions.name: retryAttempts

configDefinitions.label: Enable Ludicrous Mode
configDefinitions.description: Ludicrous mode may significantly improve performance, but metrics will be limited
configDefinitions.name: ludicrousMode

configDefinitions.label: Collect Input Metrics
configDefinitions.description: Collects and displays input metrics. Can result in rereading data unless origins are configured to cache data
configDefinitions.name: ludicrousModeInputCount

configDefinitions.label: Advanced Error Handling
configDefinitions.description: Reports the record that generates an error, when possible. Supported in single-origin pipelines
configDefinitions.name: advancedErrorHandling

configDefinitions.label: Notify on Pipeline State Changes
configDefinitions.description: Notifies via email when pipeline gets to the specified states
configDefinitions.name: notifyOnStates

configDefinitions.label: Email IDs
configDefinitions.description: Email Addresses
configDefinitions.name: emailIDs

configDefinitions.label: Error Record Policy
configDefinitions.description: Determines which variation of the record is sent to error.
configDefinitions.name: errorRecordPolicy

configDefinitions.label: Worker Count
configDefinitions.description: Number of workers. 0 to start as many workers as Kafka partitions for topic.
configDefinitions.name: workerCount

configDefinitions.label: Worker Java Options
configDefinitions.description: Add properties as needed. Changes to default settings are not recommended.
configDefinitions.name: clusterSlaveJavaOpts

configDefinitions.label: Launcher ENV
configDefinitions.description: Sets additional environment variables for the cluster launcher
configDefinitions.name: clusterLauncherEnv

configDefinitions.label: Mesos Dispatcher URL
configDefinitions.description: URL for service which launches Mesos framework
configDefinitions.name: mesosDispatcherURL

configDefinitions.label: Log Level
configDefinitions.description: Log level to use for the launched application
configDefinitions.name: logLevel

configDefinitions.label: Checkpoint Configuration Directory
configDefinitions.description: An SDC resource directory or symbolic link with HDFS/S3 configuration files core-site.xml and hdfs-site.xml
configDefinitions.name: hdfsS3ConfDir

configDefinitions.label: Rate Limit (records / sec)
configDefinitions.description: Maximum number of records per second that should be accepted into the pipeline. Rate is not limited if this is not set, or is set to 0
configDefinitions.name: rateLimit

configDefinitions.label: Max Runners
configDefinitions.description: Maximum number of runners that should be created for this pipeline. Use 0 to not impose limit.
configDefinitions.name: maxRunners

configDefinitions.label: Runner Idle Time (sec)
configDefinitions.description: When pipeline runners are idle for at least this time, run an empty batch through the runner to process any events or other time-driven functionality. Value -1 will disable this functionality completely.
configDefinitions.name: runnerIdleTIme

configDefinitions.label: Create Failure Snapshot
configDefinitions.description: Attempts to create a partial snapshot with unprocessed records if the pipeline fails
configDefinitions.name: shouldCreateFailureSnapshot

configDefinitions.name: javaUDF

configDefinitions.description: Headers to include in the request

stages.label: JDBC Query Consumer
stages.description: Reads data from a JDBC source using a query.
stages.name: com_streamsets_pipeline_stage_origin_jdbc_JdbcDSource

configDefinitions.label: Incremental Mode
configDefinitions.description: Disabling Incremental Mode will always substitute the value in Initial Offset in place of ${OFFSET} instead of the most recent value of <offsetColumn>.
configDefinitions.name: isIncrementalMode

configDefinitions.label: SQL Query
configDefinitions.description: SELECT <offset column>, ... FROM <table name> WHERE <offset column>  >  ${OFFSET} ORDER BY <offset column>
configDefinitions.name: query

configDefinitions.label: Initial Offset
configDefinitions.description: Initial value to insert for ${offset}. Subsequent queries will use the result of the Next Offset Query
configDefinitions.name: initialOffset

configDefinitions.label: Offset Column
configDefinitions.description: Column checked to track current offset.
configDefinitions.name: offsetColumn

configDefinitions.label: Number of Retries on SQL Error
configDefinitions.description: The number of retries upon a SQL Error.  To allow for the possibility of handling transient errors (ex: connection issues, deadlock, etc.), provide a positive value here.  After the specified number of retries is reached, the stage will fail upon the next error and pipeline error handling behavior will take over.
configDefinitions.name: commonSourceConfigBean.numSQLErrorRetries

configDefinitions.label: Maximum Transaction Length
configDefinitions.description: Time window to look for changes within a transaction before commit (in seconds)
configDefinitions.name: commonSourceConfigBean.txnWindow

configDefinitions.label: No-more-data Event Generation Delay (seconds)
configDefinitions.description: Number of seconds to delay when all rows have been processed, before generating the no-more-data event.  Used if you want other events to show up in the event stream first.
configDefinitions.name: commonSourceConfigBean.noMoreDataEventDelay

configDefinitions.label: Convert Timestamp To String
configDefinitions.description: Rather then representing timestamps as Data Collector DATETIME type, use String.
configDefinitions.name: commonSourceConfigBean.convertTimestampToString

configDefinitions.label: Transaction ID Column Name
configDefinitions.description: When reading a change data table, column identifying the transaction the change belongs to.
configDefinitions.name: txnIdColumnName

configDefinitions.label: Max Transaction Size
configDefinitions.description: If transactions exceed this size, they will be applied in multiple batches.
configDefinitions.name: txnMaxSize

configDefinitions.label: Additional JDBC Configuration Properties
configDefinitions.description: Additional properties to pass to the underlying JDBC driver.
configDefinitions.name: hikariConfigBean.driverProperties

configDefinitions.label: JDBC Driver Class Name
configDefinitions.description: Class name for pre-JDBC 4 compliant drivers.
configDefinitions.name: hikariConfigBean.driverClassName

configDefinitions.label: Connection Health Test Query
configDefinitions.description: Not recommended for JDBC 4 compliant drivers. Runs when a new database connection is established.
configDefinitions.name: hikariConfigBean.connectionTestQuery

configDefinitions.label: Maximum Pool Size
configDefinitions.description: Maximum number of connections to create to the data source
configDefinitions.name: hikariConfigBean.maximumPoolSize

configDefinitions.label: Minimum Idle Connections
configDefinitions.description: Minimum number of connections to maintain. It is recommended to set this to the same valueas Maximum Pool Size which effectively creates a fixed connection pool.
configDefinitions.name: hikariConfigBean.minIdle

configDefinitions.label: Connection Timeout (Seconds)
configDefinitions.description: Maximum time to wait for a connection to become available. Exceeding will cause a pipeline error.
configDefinitions.name: hikariConfigBean.connectionTimeout

configDefinitions.label: Idle Timeout (Seconds)
configDefinitions.description: Maximum amount of time that a connection is allowed to sit idle in the pool. Use 0 to opt out of an idle timeout. If set too close to or more than Max Connection Lifetime, the property is ignored.
configDefinitions.name: hikariConfigBean.idleTimeout

configDefinitions.label: Max Connection Lifetime (Seconds)
configDefinitions.description: Maximum lifetime of a connection in the pool. When reached, the connection is retired from the pool. Use 0 to set no maximum lifetime. When set, the minimum lifetime is 30 minutes.
configDefinitions.name: hikariConfigBean.maxLifetime

configDefinitions.label: Auto Commit
configDefinitions.description: Whether the connection should have property auto-commit set to true or not.
configDefinitions.name: hikariConfigBean.autoCommit

configDefinitions.label: Enforce Read-only Connection
configDefinitions.description: Should be set to true whenever possible to avoid unintended writes. Set to false with extreme caution.
configDefinitions.name: hikariConfigBean.readOnly

configDefinitions.label: Init Query
configDefinitions.description: SQL query that will be executed on all new connections when they are created, before they are added to the connection pool.
configDefinitions.name: hikariConfigBean.initialQuery

configDefinitions.label: Transaction Isolation
configDefinitions.description: Transaction isolation that should be used for all database connections.
configDefinitions.name: hikariConfigBean.transactionIsolation

configDefinitions.label: Create JDBC Header Attributes
configDefinitions.description: Generates record header attributes that provide additional details about source data, such as the original data type or source table name.
configDefinitions.name: createJDBCNsHeaders

configDefinitions.label: JDBC Header Prefix
configDefinitions.description: Prefix for the header attributes, used as follows: <prefix>.<field name>.<type of information>. For example: jdbc.<field name>.precision and jdbc.<field name>.scale
configDefinitions.name: jdbcNsHeaderPrefix

configDefinitions.label: Disable Query Validation
configDefinitions.description: Disables the validation query and does not validate query formatting such as presence of ${OFFSET} or ORDER BY clause.
configDefinitions.name: disableValidation

configDefinitions.label: On Unknown Type
configDefinitions.description: Action that should be performed when an unknown type is detected in the result set.
configDefinitions.name: unknownTypeAction

configDefinitions.label: On Record Error
configDefinitions.description: Action to take with records sent to error
configDefinitions.name: stageOnRecordError

labels: Remove Listed Fields If Their Values Are Null
Remove Listed Fields If Their Values Are Empty String
Remove Listed Fields If Their Values Are Null or Empty String
Remove Listed Fields If Their Values Are The Given Constant

configDefinitions.label: Required Fields
configDefinitions.description: Records without any of these fields are sent to error
configDefinitions.name: stageRequiredFields

configDefinitions.label: Preconditions
configDefinitions.description: Records that don't satisfy all the preconditions are sent to error
configDefinitions.name: stageRecordPreconditions

stages.label: Field Splitter
stages.description: Splits a string field based on a separator character
stages.name: com_streamsets_pipeline_stage_processor_splitter_SplitterDProcessor

configDefinitions.label: Separator
configDefinitions.description: Regular expression to use for splitting the field. If trying to split on a RegEx meta character ".$|()[{^?*+\", the character must be escaped with \
configDefinitions.name: separator

configDefinitions.label: New Split Fields
configDefinitions.description: New fields to pass split data. The last field includes any remaining unsplit data.
configDefinitions.name: fieldPathsForSplits

configDefinitions.label: Not Enough Splits
configDefinitions.description: Action for data that has fewer splits than configured field paths
configDefinitions.name: onStagePreConditionFailure

configDefinitions.label: Too Many Splits
configDefinitions.description: Action for data that more splits than configured field paths
configDefinitions.name: tooManySplitsAction

labels: Put Remaining Text in Last Field

configDefinitions.label: Field for Remaining Splits
configDefinitions.description: List field used to store any remaining splits
configDefinitions.name: remainingSplitsPath

configDefinitions.label: Original Field
configDefinitions.description: Action for the original field being split
configDefinitions.name: originalFieldAction

configDefinitions.label: On Record Error
configDefinitions.description: Action to take with records sent to error
configDefinitions.name: stageOnRecordError

configDefinitions.label: Required Fields
configDefinitions.description: Records without any of these fields are sent to error
configDefinitions.name: stageRequiredFields

configDefinitions.label: Preconditions
configDefinitions.description: Records that don't satisfy all the preconditions are sent to error
configDefinitions.name: stageRecordPreconditions

configDefinitions.label: Record Processing Mode
configDefinitions.description: If 'Record by Record' the processor takes care of record error handling, if 'Record batch' the Jython script must take care of record error handling
configDefinitions.name: processingMode

configDefinitions.label: Init Script
configDefinitions.description: Place initialization code here. Called on pipeline validate/start.
configDefinitions.name: initScript
configDefinitions.defaultValue:
# Available Objects:
#
#  sdc.state: a dict that is preserved between invocations of this script.
#         Useful for caching bits of data e.g. counters.
#  sdc.log.<loglevel>(msg, obj...): use instead of print to send log messages to the log4j log instead of stdout.
#                               loglevel is any log4j level: e.g. info, error, warn, trace.
#  sdc.getFieldNull(Record, 'field path'): Receive a constant defined above
#                                  to check if the field is typed field with value null
#  sdc.createMap(boolean listMap): Create a map for use as a field in a record.
#                            Pass True to this function to create a list map (ordered map).
#  sdc.createEvent(String type, int version): Creates a new event.
#                            Create new empty event with standard headers.
#  sdc.createMap(boolean listMap): Create a map for use as a field in a record.
#                            Pass True to this function to create a list map (ordered map).
#

# sdc.state['connection'] = new Connection().open()

configDefinitions.label: Script
configDefinitions.name: script
configDefinitions.defaultValue:
# Available constants: 
#   They are to assign a type to a field with a value null.
#   sdc.NULL_BOOLEAN, sdc.NULL_CHAR, sdc.NULL_BYTE, sdc.NULL_SHORT, sdc.NULL_INTEGER, sdc.NULL_LONG,
#   sdc.NULL_FLOAT, sdc.NULL_DOUBLE, sdc.NULL_DATE, sdc.NULL_DATETIME, sdc.NULL_TIME, sdc.NULL_DECIMAL,
#   sdc.NULL_BYTE_ARRAY, sdc.NULL_STRING, sdc.NULL_LIST, sdc.NULL_MAP
# 
# Available Objects:
# 
#  sdc.records: an array of records to process, depending on Jython processor
#           processing mode it may have 1 record or all the records in the batch.
#
#  sdc.state: a dict that is preserved between invocations of this script. 
#         Useful for caching bits of data e.g. counters.
#
#  sdc.log.<loglevel>(msg, obj...): use instead of print to send log messages to the log4j log instead of stdout.
#                               loglevel is any log4j level: e.g. info, error, warn, trace.
#
#  sdc.output.write(record): writes a record to processor output
#
#  sdc.error.write(record, message): sends a record to error
#
#  sdc.getFieldNull(Record, 'field path'): Receive a constant defined above 
#                                  to check if the field is typed field with value null
#  sdc.createRecord(String recordId): Creates a new record.
#                            Pass a recordId to uniquely identify the record and include enough information to track down the record source. 
#  sdc.createMap(boolean listMap): Create a map for use as a field in a record.
#                            Pass True to this function to create a list map (ordered map)
#
#  sdc.createEvent(String type, int version): Creates a new event.
#                            Create new empty event with standard headers.
#  sdc.toEvent(Record): Send event to event stream
#                            Only events created with sdcFunctions.createEvent are supported.
#  sdc.isPreview(): Determine if pipeline is in preview mode.
#
#  sdc.userParams: Dictionary of user-specified keys and values (from UI).
#
#
# Available Record Header Variables:
#
#  record.attributes: a map of record header attributes.
#
#  record.<header name>: get the value of 'header name'.
#
# Add additional module search paths:
#   try:
#       sdc.importLock()
#       import sys
#       sys.path.append('/some/other/dir/to/search')
#       import something
#   finally:
#       sdc.importUnlock()
#

# Sample Jython code
for record in sdc.records:
  try:
    # Change record root field value to a STRING value
    # record.value = 'Hello '


    # Change record root field value to a MAP value and create an entry
    # record.value = { 'V' : 'Hello'}

    # Access a MAP entry
    # record.value['X'] = record.value['V'] + ' World'

    # Modify a MAP entry
    # record.value['V'] = 5

    # Create an ARRAY entry
    # record.value['A'] = [ 'Element 1', 'Element 2' ]

    # Access an ARRAY entry
    # record.value['B'] = record.value['A'][0]

    # Modify an existing ARRAY entry
    # record.value['A'][0] = 100

    # Assign a integer type to a field and value null
    # record.value['null_int'] = sdc.NULL_INTEGER 

    # Check if the field is NULL_INTEGER(Both '==' and 'is' work). If so, assign a value 
    # if sdc.getFieldNull(record, '/null_int') == sdc.NULL_INTEGER:
    #    record.value['null_int'] = 123

    # Direct access to the underlying Data Collector Record. Use for read-only operations.
    # fieldAttr = record.sdcRecord.get('/value').getAttribute('attr')  

    # Create a new record with map field 
    # newRecord = sdc.createRecord(record.sourceId + ':newRecordId')
    # newRecord.value = {'field1' : 'val1', 'field2' : 'val2'}
    # sdc.output.write(newRecord)

    # Applies if the source uses WHOLE_FILE as data format
    # input_stream = record.value['fileRef'].getInputStream()
    # try:
    #   input_stream.read() #Process the input stream
    # finally:  
    #   input_stream.close()

    # Modify a record header attribute entry
    # record.attributes['name'] = record.attributes['first_name'] + ' ' + record.attributes['last_name']

    # Get a record header with field names ex. get sourceId and errorCode
    # sourceId = record.sourceId
    # errorCode = ''
    # if record.errorCode:
    #   errorCode = record.errorCode

    # Write record to processor output
    sdc.output.write(record)

  except Exception as e:
    # Send record to error
    sdc.error.write(record, str(e))

configDefinitions.label: Destroy Script
configDefinitions.description: Place cleanup code here. Called on pipeline stop.
configDefinitions.name: destroyScript
configDefinitions.defaultValue:
# Available Objects:
#
#  sdc.state: a dict that is preserved between invocations of this script.
#         Useful for caching bits of data e.g. counters.
#  sdc.log.<loglevel>(msg, obj...): use instead of print to send log messages to the log4j log instead of stdout.
#                               loglevel is any log4j level: e.g. info, error, warn, trace.
#  sdc.getFieldNull(Record, 'field path'): Receive a constant defined above 
#                                  to check if the field is typed field with value null.
#  sdc.createMap(boolean listMap): Create a map for use as a field in a record.
#                            Pass True to this function to create a list map (ordered map).
#  sdc.createEvent(String type, int version): Creates a new event.
#                            Create new empty event with standard headers.
#  sdc.toEvent(Record): Send event to event stream.
#                            Only events created with sdcFunctions.createEvent are supported.
#

# sdc.state['connection'].close()

configDefinitions.label: Record Type
configDefinitions.description: Record type to use during script execution
configDefinitions.name: scriptRecordType

configDefinitions.label: Parameters in Script
configDefinitions.description:
Parameters and values for use in script.
Access in user script as sdc.userParams.
configDefinitions.name: userParams

configDefinitions.label: Script Error as Record Error
configDefinitions.description: Handle Scripts errors with the same logic as On Record Error.
configDefinitions.name: scriptErrorAsRecordError

configDefinitions.label: On Record Error
configDefinitions.description: Action to take with records sent to error
configDefinitions.name: stageOnRecordError

configDefinitions.label: Required Fields
configDefinitions.description: Records without any of these fields are sent to error
configDefinitions.name: stageRequiredFields

configDefinitions.label: Preconditions
configDefinitions.description: Records that don't satisfy all the preconditions are sent to error
configDefinitions.name: stageRecordPreconditions

stages.label: Elasticsearch
stages.description: Upload data to an Elasticsearch cluster
stages.name: com_streamsets_pipeline_stage_destination_elasticsearch_ElasticSearchDTarget

configDefinitions.label: Time Basis
configDefinitions.description: Time basis to use for a record. Enter an expression that evaluates to a datetime. To use the processing time, enter ${time:now()}. To use field values, use '${record:value("<field path>")}'.
configDefinitions.name: elasticSearchConfig.timeDriver

configDefinitions.label: Data Time Zone
configDefinitions.description: Time zone to use to resolve the datetime of a time based index
configDefinitions.name: elasticSearchConfig.timeZoneID

configDefinitions.label: Document ID
configDefinitions.description: An expression which evaluates to a document ID. Required for create/update/delete. Optional for index, leave blank to use auto-generated IDs.
configDefinitions.name: elasticSearchConfig.docIdTemplate

configDefinitions.label: Parent ID
configDefinitions.description: An expression which evaluates to a document ID for the parent in a parent/child hierarchy.
configDefinitions.name: elasticSearchConfig.parentIdTemplate

configDefinitions.label: Routing
configDefinitions.description: An expression which evaluates to a document ID whose shard will be indexed on.
configDefinitions.name: elasticSearchConfig.routingTemplate

configDefinitions.label: Default Operation
configDefinitions.description: Default operation to perform if sdc.operation.type is not set in record header.
configDefinitions.name: elasticSearchConfig.defaultOperation

configDefinitions.label: Unsupported Operation Handling
configDefinitions.description: Action to take when operation type is not supported
configDefinitions.name: elasticSearchConfig.unsupportedAction

configDefinitions.label: Additional Properties
configDefinitions.description: Additional properties for the request
configDefinitions.name: elasticSearchConfig.rawAdditionalProperties

configDefinitions.label: Mode
configDefinitions.description: Security mode to use for Elasticsearch authentication
configDefinitions.name: elasticSearchConfig.connection.securityConfig.securityMode

configDefinitions.label: User Name
configDefinitions.description: Elasticsearch user name
configDefinitions.name: elasticSearchConfig.connection.securityConfig.securityUser

configDefinitions.label: Password
configDefinitions.description: Elasticsearch password
configDefinitions.name: elasticSearchConfig.connection.securityConfig.securityPassword

configDefinitions.label: Enable SSL
configDefinitions.description: Enables SSL usage
configDefinitions.name: elasticSearchConfig.connection.securityConfig.enableSSL

configDefinitions.label: HTTP URLs
configDefinitions.description: Elasticserarch HTTP/HTTPS Endpoint.
configDefinitions.name: elasticSearchConfig.connection.serverUrl

configDefinitions.label: HTTP Port
configDefinitions.description: Port number for Elasticsearch server. Default is 9200 for http and 443 for https
configDefinitions.name: elasticSearchConfig.connection.port

configDefinitions.label: Use Security
configDefinitions.description: Use Security
configDefinitions.name: elasticSearchConfig.connection.useSecurity

configDefinitions.label: Additional HTTP Params
configDefinitions.description: Additional HTTP Params.
configDefinitions.name: elasticSearchConfig.params

configDefinitions.label: Detect Additional Nodes in Cluster
configDefinitions.description: Select to automatically discover additional Elasticsearch nodes in the cluster. Do not use if the Data Collector is on a different network from the cluster.
configDefinitions.name: elasticSearchConfig.clientSniff

configDefinitions.label: On Record Error
configDefinitions.description: Action to take with records sent to error
configDefinitions.name: stageOnRecordError

configDefinitions.label: Required Fields
configDefinitions.description: Records without any of these fields are sent to error
configDefinitions.name: stageRequiredFields

configDefinitions.label: Preconditions
configDefinitions.description: Records that don't satisfy all the preconditions are sent to error
configDefinitions.name: stageRecordPreconditions

stages.label: Dev Raw Data Source
stages.description: Add Raw data to the source.
stages.name: com_streamsets_pipeline_stage_devtest_rawdata_RawDataDSource

configDefinitions.label: On Record Error
configDefinitions.description: Action to take with records sent to error
configDefinitions.name: stageOnRecordError

stages.label: Write Directly to Control Hub - statistics are not aggregated across Data Collectors
stages.description: Writes pipeline statistics to Control Hub directly without any aggregation
stages.name: com_streamsets_pipeline_stage_destination_devnull_StatsDpmDirectlyDTarget

configDefinitions.label: List of formats that should be displayed to the user.
configDefinitions.name: displayFormats

configDefinitions.label: Compression Format
configDefinitions.description: Compression formats gzip, bzip2, xz, lzma, Pack200, DEFLATE and Z are supported. Archive formats 7z, ar, arj, cpio, dump, tar and zip are supported.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.compression

configDefinitions.label: File Name Pattern within Compressed Directory
configDefinitions.description: A glob pattern that defines the pattern of the file names within the compressed directory.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.filePatternInArchive

configDefinitions.label: Ignore Control Characters
configDefinitions.description: Use only if required as it impacts reading performance
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.removeCtrlChars

configDefinitions.label: Max Line Length
configDefinitions.description: Longer lines are truncated
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.textMaxLineLen

configDefinitions.label: Use Custom Delimiter
configDefinitions.description: Use custom delimiters to create records
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.useCustomDelimiter

configDefinitions.label: Custom Delimiter
configDefinitions.description: One or more characters. Leading and trailing spaces are stripped.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.customDelimiter

configDefinitions.label: Include Custom Delimiter
configDefinitions.description: Include custom delimiters in the data
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.includeCustomDelimiterInTheText

configDefinitions.label: Max Object Length (chars)
configDefinitions.description: Larger objects are not processed
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.jsonMaxObjectLen

configDefinitions.label: Multi Character Field Delimiter
configDefinitions.description: Delimiter between fields in multi-character delimited mode.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.multiCharacterFieldDelimiter

configDefinitions.label: Multi Character Line Delimiter
configDefinitions.description: Delimiter between lines (i.e. different records) in multi-character delimited mode.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.multiCharacterLineDelimiter

configDefinitions.label: Escape Character
configDefinitions.description: Character used to escape quote and delimiter characters. To disable select Other and enter \u0000 (unicode codepoint for the NULL character).
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.csvCustomEscape

configDefinitions.label: Quote Character
configDefinitions.description: Character used to quote string fields. To disable select Other and enter \u0000 (unicode codepoint for the NULL character).
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.csvCustomQuote

configDefinitions.label: Field Separator
configDefinitions.description: Separator between fields - can be one or more characters.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.csvUnivocityFieldSeparator

configDefinitions.label: Escape Character
configDefinitions.description: Character used to escape quote and delimiter characters.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.csvUnivocityEscape

configDefinitions.label: Quote Character
configDefinitions.description: Character used to quote string fields.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.csvUnivocityQuote

configDefinitions.label: Line Separator
configDefinitions.description: One or two characters separating individual records.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.csvUnivocityLineSeparator

configDefinitions.label: CSV Parser
configDefinitions.description: CSV parser to use. In new pipelines, use the default Univocity parser for better performance
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.csvParser

labels: Apache Commons - slower but more powerful

configDefinitions.label: Allow Extra Columns
configDefinitions.description: Allows processing rows with more fields than the header. When not enabled, the rows are sent to error
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.csvAllowExtraColumns

configDefinitions.label: Extra Column Prefix
configDefinitions.description: Each extra column is labeled with this prefix followed by an integer
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.csvExtraColumnPrefix

configDefinitions.label: Max Record Length (chars)
configDefinitions.description: Larger objects are not processed
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.csvMaxObjectLen

configDefinitions.label: Max Columns
configDefinitions.description: Maximal number of columns to parse per line.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.csvUnivocityMaxColumns

configDefinitions.label: Max Characters Per Column
configDefinitions.description: Maximal number of character that will be read per single column.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.csvUnivocityMaxCharsPerColumn

configDefinitions.label: Lines to Skip
configDefinitions.description: Number of lines to skip before reading
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.csvSkipStartLines

configDefinitions.label: Parse NULLs
configDefinitions.description: When checked, configured string constant will be converted into NULL field.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.parseNull

configDefinitions.label: NULL constant
configDefinitions.description: String constant that should be converted to a NULL rather then passed as it is.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.nullConstant

configDefinitions.label: Delimiter Element
configDefinitions.description: XML element that acts as a record delimiter.  This may be an element name, with elements having that local name directly under the root as records.  Or, it can be a simplified XPath expression (see docs), with elements matching the XPath expression as records.  Leaving it blank will treat the whole XML document as one record.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.xmlRecordElement

configDefinitions.label: Preserve Root Element
configDefinitions.description: Include the root element in the output records. The root element is the last element defined in the record element delimiter or is the root element of the XML document when no delimiter is defined
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.preserveRootElement

configDefinitions.label: Include Field XPaths
configDefinitions.description: Include XPath expressions that indicate the path to the input node that was parsed to create each field.  If enabled, each field will receive an attribute named "xpath" whose value is the XPath expression.  Any namespace prefixes will be mapped to the full URI via new xmlns:* attributes in the record header.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.includeFieldXpathAttributes

configDefinitions.label: Namespaces
configDefinitions.description: Namespace context to use if the delimiter is an XPath expression.  This should map namespace prefixes to URIs.  Any namespace prefix that is used in the record separator expression must be defined here.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.xPathNamespaceContext

configDefinitions.label: Output Field Attributes
configDefinitions.description: Generate field attributes in output record for XML namespace declarations, and XML attributes.  Without this option, they will continue to be output as individual fields (separate from the element value).
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.outputFieldAttributes

configDefinitions.label: Max Record Length (chars)
configDefinitions.description: Larger records are not processed
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.xmlMaxObjectLen

configDefinitions.label: Max Line Length
configDefinitions.description: Longer lines are truncated
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.logMaxObjectLen

configDefinitions.label: Retain Original Line
configDefinitions.description: Indicates if the original line of log should be retained in the record
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.retainOriginalLine

configDefinitions.label: Regular Expression
configDefinitions.description: The regular expression which is used to parse the log line.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.regex

configDefinitions.label: Field Path To RegEx Group Mapping
configDefinitions.description: Map groups in the regular expression to field paths
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.fieldPathsToGroupName

configDefinitions.label: Grok Pattern Definition
configDefinitions.description: Define your own grok patterns which will be used to parse the logs
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.grokPatternDefinition

configDefinitions.label: Grok Pattern
configDefinitions.description: The grok pattern which is used to parse the log line
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.grokPattern

configDefinitions.label: Trim Stack Trace to Length
configDefinitions.description: Any line that does not match the expected pattern will be treated as a Stack trace as long as it is part of the same message. The stack trace will be trimmed to the specified number of lines.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.maxStackTraceLines

configDefinitions.label: Custom Log4J Format
configDefinitions.description: Specify your own custom log4j format.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.log4jCustomLogFormat

configDefinitions.label: Avro Schema Location
configDefinitions.description: Where to load the Avro Schema from.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.avroSchemaSource

configDefinitions.label: Avro Schema
configDefinitions.description: Overrides the schema included in the data (if any). Optionally use the runtime:loadResource function to use a schema stored in a file.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.avroSchema

configDefinitions.label: Schema Registry URLs
configDefinitions.description: List of Confluent Schema Registry URLs
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.schemaRegistryUrls

configDefinitions.label: Lookup Schema By
configDefinitions.description: Whether to look up the Avro Schema by ID or fetch the latest schema for a Subject.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.schemaLookupMode

configDefinitions.label: Skip Union Indexes
configDefinitions.description: When checked generated records will not contain header attributes identifying which part of a union was used to read data in. Data Collector does not use the header attributes directly, thus this can be selected safely unless the pipeline explicitly depends on them.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.avroSkipUnionIndex

configDefinitions.label: Protobuf Descriptor File
configDefinitions.description: Protobuf Descriptor File (.desc) path relative to SDC resources directory
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.protoDescriptorFile

configDefinitions.label: Message Type
configDefinitions.description: Fully Qualified Message Type name. Use format <packageName>.<messageTypeName>
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.messageType

configDefinitions.label: Delimited Messages
configDefinitions.description: Should be checked when the input data is prepended with the message size. When unchecked only a single message can be present in the source file/Kafka message, etc.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.isDelimited

configDefinitions.label: Max Data Size (bytes)
configDefinitions.description: Larger objects are not processed
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.binaryMaxObjectLen

configDefinitions.label: TypesDB File Path
configDefinitions.description: User-specified TypesDB file. Overrides the included version.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.typesDbPath

configDefinitions.label: Convert Hi-Res Time & Interval
configDefinitions.description: Converts high resolution time format interval and timestamp to unix time in (ms).
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.convertTime

configDefinitions.label: Exclude Interval
configDefinitions.description: Excludes the interval field from output records.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.excludeInterval

configDefinitions.label: Record Generation Mode
configDefinitions.description: Determines the data that is included in the record generated from a flow. Only applies to NetFlow 9.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.netflowOutputValuesMode

configDefinitions.label: Max Templates in Cache
configDefinitions.description: Controls the maximum number of templates to cache from all sources. Additional templates received when this limit is reached cause the eviction of existing templates, least recently used first. Leave as -1 for unlimited. Only applies to NetFlow 9.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.maxTemplateCacheSize

configDefinitions.label: Template Cache Timeout (ms)
configDefinitions.description: Controls the maximum length of time flow templates are cached, after last being used to parse a data flow. Leave as -1 for unlimited (never expires). Only applies to NetFlow 9.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.templateCacheTimeoutMs

configDefinitions.label: Record Generation Mode
configDefinitions.description: Determines the data that is included in the record generated from a flow. Only applies to NetFlow 9.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.netflowOutputValuesModeDatagram

configDefinitions.label: Max Templates in Cache
configDefinitions.description: Controls the maximum number of templates to cache from all sources. Additional templates received when this limit is reached cause the eviction of existing templates, least recently used first. Leave as -1 for unlimited. Only applies to NetFlow 9.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.maxTemplateCacheSizeDatagram

configDefinitions.label: Template Cache Timeout (ms)
configDefinitions.description: Controls the maximum length of time flow templates are cached, after last being used to parse a data flow. Leave as -1 for unlimited (never expires). Only applies to NetFlow 9.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.templateCacheTimeoutMsDatagram

configDefinitions.label: Buffer Size (bytes)
configDefinitions.description: Size of the Buffer used to copy the file.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.wholeFileMaxObjectLen

configDefinitions.label: Rate per second
configDefinitions.description: Rate / sec to manipulate bandwidth requirements for File Transfer. Use <= 0 to opt out. Default unit is B/sec
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.rateLimit

configDefinitions.label: Verify Checksum
configDefinitions.description: When checked verifies the checksum of the stream during read.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.verifyChecksum

configDefinitions.label: Excel Header Option
configDefinitions.description: Excel headers
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.excelHeader

configDefinitions.label: Skip Cells With No Header
configDefinitions.description: If checked, cells that have no associated header value will be skipped.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.excelSkipCellsWithNoHeader

configDefinitions.label: Include Cells With Empty Value
configDefinitions.description: If checked, cells that have empty value will be included.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.excelIncludeCellsWithEmptyValue

configDefinitions.label: Read All Sheets
configDefinitions.description: Specifies whether all sheets from the document should be read.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.excelReadAllSheets

configDefinitions.label: Import Sheets
configDefinitions.description: Names of the sheets that should be imported. Other sheets will be ignored.
configDefinitions.name: dataFormatConfig.excelSheetNames
